Style Guide

The Grid

The grid is a responsive 12 column grid system.

.lg_4
.lg_4
.lg_4
.md_3
.md_9
.sm_3
.sm_9

Usage: 

    
<div class="row">
    <div class="lg_4">
        <div class="display_col">.lg_4</div>
    </div>
    <div class="lg_4">
        <div class="display_col">.lg_4</div>
    </div>
    <div class="lg_4">
        <div class="display_col">.lg_4</div>
    </div>
</div>
<div class="row">
    <div class="md_3">
        <div class="display_col">.md_3</div>
    </div>
    <div class="md_9">
        <div class="display_col">.md_9</div>
    </div>
</div>
<div class="row">
    <div class="sm_9">
        <div class="display_col">.sm_9</div>
    </div>
    <div class="sm_3">
        <div class="display_col">.sm_3</div>
    </div>
</div>

Use the .row class to clear the floated column classes (.lg_* .md_* and .sm_*). The .container class can be used to contain .row to a max-width.

Buttons

    
<button class="btn btn-primary">Primary</button>
<button class="btn btn-secondary">Secondary</button>

Use the class .block to make a button fill a column.

Carousel


//reveal module pattern
var reveal = (function(){

var privateVar = 'private variable';

var privateFunctionOne = function(){
console.log('I am a private function');
};

var privateFunctionTwo = function(){
console.log('I am yet another private function');
};

return {
privateString : privateVar,
privateOne : privateFunctionOne,
privateTwo : privateFunctionTwo
};

})();

//usage
reveal.privateString; // output : 'private variable'
reveal.privateOne(); // output : 'I am a private function'
reveal.privateTwo(); // output : 'I am yet another private function'
